references.paper_title: VIEScore: Towards explainable metrics for conditional image synthesis evaluation
references.reason: This paper presents the current state-of-the-art evaluation method for conditional image generation, serving as a key comparison point for the proposed CIGEVAL framework.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: As it introduces CLIP, a foundational model for measuring the alignment between text and images, this work is used as a tool in their own framework.
This work introduces diffusion models, a core technology used in conditional image generation, which the CIGEVAL framework evaluates.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This reference is crucial due to its contribution to high-resolution image synthesis using latent diffusion models, a key area for conditional image generation.

references.paper_title: Grounding dino: Marrying dino with grounded pre-training for open-set object detection
references.reason: This reference is important because the authors implement Grounding with GroundingDino (Liu et al., 2024) for use in their toolbox.
